medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with one day of abdominal pain that initially was diffuse and crampy. Last night, there was diffuse, watery diarrhea and tenesmus, with a baseline of constipation. The pain became more focal and localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) with continued diffuse pain. The patient also experienced nausea, vomiting, and dry heaves. Denies fever, chills, or recent antibiotics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anxiety, depression, chronic pain, fibromyalgia. Previous surgery includes left salpingo-oophorectomy.
